intro: Erigeron huteri, commonly known as the blueweed or blue fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron huteri is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits. It also serves as a food source for various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
